webshotapi.ApiClient module¶

class webshotapi.ApiClient.ApiClient(api_key, api_version='v1', api_host='https://api.webshotapi.com', pools_size=4)¶

Bases: webshotapi.RequestClient.RequestClient

extract(link: str, params: dict)¶

Extract html selectors with css styles, words with coordinates(x,y,width,height). You can also extract html of rendered page and clean text

Parameters

  • link – link to website to take screenshot

  • params – dict with parameters check available parameters in https://webshotapi.com/docs/api/

Returns

RESTResponse object

  • link – link to website to take screenshot

  • params – dict with parameters check available parameters in https://webshotapi.com/docs/api/

RESTResponse object

screenshot_json(link: str, params: dict)¶

Take screenshot and return json data. You can also extract html and text

Parameters

  • link – link to website to take screenshot

  • params – dict with parameters check available parameters in https://webshotapi.com/docs/api/

Returns

RESTResponse object

screenshot_png(link: str, params: dict)¶

Take screenshot and return png image

Parameters

  • link – link to website to take screenshot

  • params – dict with parameters check available parameters in https://webshotapi.com/docs/api/

Example

import webshotapi

TOKEN = ‘PUT_YOUR_TOKEN_HERE’

client = webshotapi(TOKEN)

Returns

RESTResponse object

return data from api

getheader(name, default=None)¶

Returns a given response header.

Parameters

  • name – Header name

  • default – Set default value if header not exists

Return type

string

getheaders()¶

Returns a dictionary of the response headers.

is_json()¶

Check that response data is json document

Return type

bool

save(path)¶

Save response data to file. If you set file path without extension method will auto detect output file extension from mime type. Example you take screenshot and want to save to jpg. Set path to: 1. /tmp/example_1_file_name -> will detect extension from mime type and save file to /tmp/example_1_file_name.jpg 2. /tmp/example_2_file_name.jpg -> extension is in file path so dont detect extension from mime and save to /tmp/example_2_file_name.jpg

Parameters

path – string file path

Returns

return saved file path

Return type

string

webshotapi.RequestClient module¶

class webshotapi.RequestClient.RequestClient(api_key, api_version='v1', api_host='https://api.webshotapi.com', pools_size=4)¶

Bases: object

add_multi(data)¶

Add to concurrency request mode queue new request.

Parameters

data – tuple of request example: (‘screenshot/json’,’POST’, {url:’https://example.com’,width:1920}) (REST_SERVER_PATH, HTTP_METHOD, PARAMS)

Returns

RequestClient Object

exec(on_request_completed=None, on_requests_error=None, max_requests: int = None)¶

Run all requests added to concurrency mode queue

Parameters

  • on_request_completed – function fired async when request return data

  • on_requests_error – function fired async when request return error

  • max_requests – How much concurrency requests can send to server in same time.

Returns

info()¶

‘ Get info about account. Return info about free requests etc.

multi()¶

Create concurrency requests mode

Returns

RequestClient Object

request(path, method, params={}, headers={})¶

Send request to REST server

Parameters

  • path – REST path on server

  • method – HTTP METHOD [GET,POST,PUT,DELETE]

  • params – dictionary of parameters to send

  • headers – dictionary of headers to send

Returns

RESTResponse object
